Reviews.Title: “Very nice style hotel reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: High_Falutin63
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful and unique hotel. I was worried by some reviews but pleasantly surprised. We stayed in the standard queen and whilst it was small it was roomy enough for us and the decor most unique. Tiny entry to the bathroom looked like a cupboard but surprisingly spacious and it was spotlessly clean. Didn't see any evidence of dirtiness or lack of maintenance described by other reviewers. Perhaps the owners have taken on comments and undertaken improvements. Charming guest common room and the area for breakfast in the Atrium looked good. Didn't get to test the food as we had an early departure. Perfect location for SCG, Football stadium and Hordern Pavillion. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, well located to CBD”
Reviews.Author: wilsden
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Manor House Boutique hotel for a 3 day stay in Sydney with no great expectations, but were very pleasantly surprised. Our room, No 3, had a large sitting room with flat screen TV, tea and coffee making facilities, a ward robe, ironing board and bar fridge, not to mention a comfy couch. Our bed room had a king sized bed, flat screen TV and an en-suite bathroom. There was also another bathroom off the sitting room with a toilet and bath/shower and hand basin. The sitting room and bed room have their own air con systems. Even though this room is at the front of the hotel there was no street noise to mention. The hotel has a large communal sitting room with cable TV with tea and coffee available for guesta, there is also a computer for guest use, or free wifi if you have your own computer. The breakfast area is a light and airy atrium with a small pool in one corner. Breakfast consists of cereal, yoghurt, fruit and toast [do it yourself] as well as brewed coffee and tea making, the area is large and does not feel cramped if other guests are present. There are plenty of restaurants and bars close by for meals as well as a list of take away delivery services. A must try is the Greek restaurant in Oxford street, the lamb shoulder is melt in the mouth tender. The Hotel is an easy 25/30 minute walk into the CBD crossing through Hyde Park. there are also plenty of bus connections available. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay again on return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: mattban
Reviews.Content: A small boutique hotel, nice stately building and room (we had the hollywood room-2 x queen beds in one room with tidy en-suite), quiet due to being at the rear of the premises. small plunge pool but clean. kids loved it. our room was very good but probably needed a more though clean - bedding was immaculate; probably doesn't need the extra wardrobes-after all does anyone unpack their clothes for short stays! parking is limited (it is sydney!) but we only walked 8 mins to surry hills for tea (BILLS, 355 crown st-superb!). breakfast is supplied although basic. A LITTLE GEM! THIS IS A GREAT PLACE, GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY-WE WILL STAY AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Ali-May-99
Reviews.Content: This sweet old Victorian-era building offers a fantastic location at a great price. Period furniture and high ceilings give it a lovely old world charm. However, you really do get what you pay for. The carpet is badly patched in some places, sealant around the bath is black with mould in some places, and overall the place needs a good clean. Old and worn can be quaint, however unclean can be uncomfortable. The most dissapointing thing was that the ceiling in my room leaked all night, luckily just missing the bed but leaving rather a wet patch on the carpet (and possibly leaking through to the room below). The ceiling in the breakfast area also leaked badly, leaving water over the tiled floor.

Reviews.Title: “good location in sydney”
Reviews.Author: yori54
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights ,2 couples,on april 2011.its a small hotel,antique furnishing,comfortable bed,and quiet big rooms.the main attraction is that the hotel is its location- very close to oxford srteet-many shops and boutiques,many restaurants and bars are 5 to ten minutes by walking.breakfast is too modest,and need to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Stately old hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Down_Under01
Reviews.Content: A stately boutique hotel, aging, but still comfortable. We thought the hotel was good value, with massive bedrooms (King), comfortable bed, and a deep single spa bath. The antique furnishings are well suited and match rest of the decor nicely. Our TV was on the way out, but we didn't come to Sydney to watch telly! (Pity though.) Dust on top of furnishings. A few odd mechanical noises outside at night, but not for long. Friendly and helpful reception and a huge lounge for guests to enjoy a cuppa with biscuits, newspapers, watch a big screen TV or choose a book and relax in the old leather chairs. A quaint indoor pool (no child fence) incorporated in the spacious breakfast area is an unusual but attractive feature. The continental breakfast (no cooked breakfast available) is very basic but adequate. Twinnings tea :-) No other meals, but it is just around the corner from the Oxford Street shops and wonderful restaurants. Try the Thai Nesia - unbelievable! Walkable to King's Cross if you must go, but a bus trip to the Bridge and waterfront attractions. Taxi from the airport was $56 and half an hour, back it was $32 and 15 min. If it's in the right location for you, and you enjoy a bit of nostalgia, I would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious rubbish but in a good location”
Reviews.Author: peterkar
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and were well looked after by the staff although they mainly arrived once the weekend was finished - it seemed a perversity to be paying more for the room in the weekend... Lovers of antiques should not stay at this hotel - it's full of old junk, certainly. More attention needs to be paid to cleanliness: our room showed the classical signs of hotel sloppiness - dirt behind the door, mould in the bathroom tile grouting, dust on furniture ledges. We were granted one very thin, very small bathroom towel each day and a hand towel to share. The 'continental' breakfast was the usual cereal, milk and yoghurt (canned fruit arrived on Monday) with a toaster and a coffee maker producing the world's worst coffee. All in all, the place was redeemed only by a keen young staff and its location, a short walk along Oxford St into town, or along Oxford St towards Woollahra - one of Sydney's fashion parades.

Reviews.Title: “We WILL be back”
Reviews.Author: JandJteam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before checking out the Trip Advisor ratings so we were a little concerned about the property but what a delightful surprise! We had requested a quietly located room and that is what we got. It was nicely appointed and we we would not hesitate staying again. The property, at full capacity, holds only thirty people so it was very civilised in the very breakfast atrium. There is also an air conditioned lounge with comfy leather lounges and papers, books, widescreen TV, tea coffee etc The local area offered great restaurants, coffee etc( the reception staff made some good suggestions) and it was easy walking distance to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful escape”
Reviews.Author: TheLoudAustralians
Reviews.Content: This little place is perfect for a weekend getaway. We stay here when there are events on at the SCG or the SFS as it is only a 5 minute walk. The rooms are divine and have a great homely feel. The only downside is the lack of parking, and the traffic noise of Flinders St.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: peleer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Sydney about 20 times and try to find the best prices for good hotels by searching various Australian travel sites. I reserved this in September and stayed 4 nights in December 2010. Booked directly with the hotel and rate was $150-$165 per night. Winnie at the front desk gave me the quickest check-in I've ever had anywhere. My room was beautiful, but quite small -- no desk, but there is a lounge area on the main floor with several desks, comfy couches, reading material and big screen t.v. The bathroom was large with a tub and marble/brass fittings, but the lighting was very poor. Other than that, the place was great -- fridge in room, good selection on t.v. and location fantastic - close to Oxford Street and Crown Street, both excellent shopping and eating areas. Room was very quiet and hotel is secure at night. Continental breakfast is available in sunny courtyard, with local newspapers available free. Pool is more like a big hot tub without the jets! Met two other front desk Staff, John and Tai, both of whom were also helpful, professional and friendly. This mansion used to belong to to the Lord Mayor of Sydney and it was a pleasure to stay in such a gorgeous, historical treasure. Taxi to the airport took less than 20 minutes -- $38 from and $27 to.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURES - TERRIBLE - WAY OVERPRICED!”
Reviews.Author: JamesPatricks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night and had a terrible experience. WAY overpriced, noisy rooms and floors, old appliances and features, weird atmosphere and there is only 2 parking spaces for the entire hotel. Terrible treatment from the staff when we complained and no apologies for giving us the wrong room. STAY ELSEWHERE!! You'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JeremyCBA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. The room was fine and the staff were excellent. Parking is available but is limited.

Reviews.Title: “So Romantic”
Reviews.Author: traci_rae
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The room was enormous and the bed as fantastic. Our trip was short, only an overnight stay to see Wicked. I just wanted a warm, hotel with some charm. The Manor delivered. service was great from booking to checkout. Breakfast was light, but great to sit beside the indoor pool on a rainy winters day. A little gem a small stroll from the heart of Darlinghurst.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: groveromy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently as my husband had a course at ST Vincents hospital which was a five minute walk door to door. We travelled with an almost two year old and had an absolutely lovely stay. We were made to feel very welcome, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was spotless and comfortable - it was like a home away from home. A port-a-cot was available and it was set up ready to use. The hotel is on a busy road but you can't hear any traffic noises, nor were we disturbed by any other guests, so I think the walls must be quite thick, which is always good! The morning breakfast was refreshing, simple and a great choice for all diets - cereals, toast, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea, juice etc. Perfect for helping a toddler choose something to eat. Lovely ambience by the pool too. We ate dinner around the corner at a Greek place called Santorini which was absolutely divine and authentic - just like it really is in Greece. I really recommend this hotel if you want to get away from all the sterile and impersonal feel of the big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, quirky and well located but better for a winter stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the deluxe room and it was really nice. Two bathrooms, a very comfortable bed and a nicely furnished loungeroom attached - you could say luxurious. The library is a classy place to hang out and so is the covered courtyard and spa. Free off street parking is available on first come first served basis. The location is great - walking distance to chic cafes in Paddington and Oxford Street nightlife. I would recommend a winter stay as the air-con wasn't great and the (huge) plasma TV screen in the bedroom gives off a bit of heat as well. Very friendly staff willing to please but this is not a big hotel with porters and waitstaff running around everywhere; you'll probably find one guy who does everything. Overall a great find for a city break in Sydney!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrinceCarlo
Reviews.Content: My room was great - high ornate ceiling, deep bathtub. The lounge and breakfast area are very pleasant - away from the bustle of Taylor Square, but very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Simply GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: pulltabhere
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to treat ourselves to a King Suite at Manor House last weekend. We booked on wotif.com and for $200 had the most fabulous room! The HUGE room was filled with stunning furniture and a VERY comfy King sized bed. We even had our own little private balcony! Our bathroom was massive as well, and the spa was just perfect! While the breakfast provided wasn't terribly exciting, the warm and lovely service and pure beauty of this gorgeous property in a total oasis of calm. The Saturday we stayed there had been races and a music festival, and as we walked back to the hotel there were some REALLY rowdy people around, but our room was totally silent. The location was fabulous as well - an 11 minute walk to town hall/the CBD. I'd probably recommend getting a cab from the city to the hotel though - its an uphill stretch!! All up - this hotel was a total pleasure! I want to go back already!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Kathiiy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the antique furniture and the bed was very comfotable. It was also nice to have the guest lounge to use. Excellent breakfast selection in the morning. Would probably stay here again for an overnight excursion but maybe not for longer stays due to the smaller size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “walm and welcome”
Reviews.Author: phdavies
Reviews.Content: had a beautiful 2 nights in this hotel , if you love Victorian era homes this hotel is a treat , close to oxford street and the nightlife and you can walk into the centre of the city in 10 min, breakfast was a bit average, but that may be because there was no bacon and eggs on offer would recomend to couples for a romantic weekend in the city

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality plus”
Reviews.Author: crocks
Reviews.Content: Very generous hosts, when we arrived, we we offered breakfast free of charge and our bags were looked after until check in time - later. Very pleasant rooom, great breakfast included the following morning. Lounge with tea and coffee. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and filthy matteresses!”
Reviews.Author: rogercook
Reviews.Content: Checked in after 23 hour flight, went to bed to be woken by bed bugs that had bitten me. Bedding was changed - mattress cover absolutely filthy - bugs returned. Moved to another room - no bugs, but very shabby, dirty, tired, and in need of refurbishment. Staff the only saving grace - all charming - but do not stay there - its a dump!

Reviews.Title: “This was one of our worst experiences so far!”
Reviews.Author: PMTravellers
Reviews.Content: This Boutique Hotel is one of our worst experiences after staying in many hotels world wide. Arrived at the hotel after flying in from New Zealand (turned out to be 12 hrs travel) to be told they had 'upgraded' us to a more luxurious room! We should have know better! The room was right next to reception! and unfortunately the desk is manned 24 hrs! The bedhead in the room is against the reception wall and when the 'night watchman' received phone calls during the night enquiring about accommodation we were able to hear the whole conversation. Plus his typing on the computer the remainder of the time. Of course when anyone arrived back to their room they were greeted very loudly by the night watchman. Plus anyone staying in the rooms upstairs can be heard moving about. We pointed out to the unfriendly manager the next morning, in a friendly manner, that they should not use this room and the reasons plus suggested that she should stay in it a night to 'appreciate' the noise level. She did not apologise just suggested that we ask for an upstairs room on our next visit (not likely!) and that we owed approx $3 for local phone calls! only positive is the breakfast which was included in the room rate. We certainly will not stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “For a miniscule room and dirty sheets, the Manor House can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Cartoonist
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of booking this hotel based on the reviews below. Unfriendly and unwelcoming staff, a TINY cramped room and questionable housekeeping (There was a dried contact lens in my sheets, among other remnants of the previous guest) made this hotel far from charming. At a rate of $270 AU a night, you can do much better. The Medina on Crown is in the same neighborhood and last time I stayed, they changed their sheets between guests.

Reviews.Title: “A cut above”
Reviews.Author: spbyrne
Reviews.Content: A cut above even the more lavish designer boutique hotels. Well appointed rooms with some real antiques. Well priced, if you shop about. Get a back room on the first floor to avoid busy Flinders St traffic noise, which is a good loaction. The continental breakfast is rare for a Sydney boutique hotel. Some parking but you need to be first in-best dressed.

HotelInfo.Name: Manor House Boutique Hotel Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 86 Flinders St | Darlinghurst, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
